description.narrative: The Humanitarian Logistics Framework is designed to provide strengthened flexibility, quality and reach to respond to frequent disasters, and potentially respond to simultaneous disasters if required. The framework focuses on: strengthening existing strategic partnerships and operational inter-operability with the Australian defence Force and non-government organisations ensuring closer supply chain coordination with United Nations and other international organisations, NGOs and other donors; and establishing a new enhanced Humanitarian Logistics Period Offer with a commercial provider to deliver high quality, flexible and responsive humanitarian logistics services. There are three main components contained within the new Humanitarian Logistics Period Offer: core management service; warehouse management; and responses to humanitarian emergencies. The total value of this initiative is $10.5 million over 4 years, starting 2012-13.
